item.title: TypeScript over JavaScript, Always
item.description: Prelude As a developer, JavaScript is inevitable. Unless you’re a dba or mobile app developer I suppose, but I digress. When working with JavaScript applications, you certainly have to be using a build pipeline of some description. If you are not at least bundling and minifying you are certainly doing it wrong, and if that process isn’t automated somehow then your not doing it right. Using new language features makes JavaScript palatable, so you are already using ES6 (or newer) features, and because compatibility on the web is hard, you have a transpiler step already to convert all your code to ES5 (or ES3, I don’t judge compatibility decisions).
